Gilles,

On 2/20/07, Gilles Scokart <gscokart@...> wrote:
> If PriceScanner is a class that use XMLParser

Yes, that was the intent.  Sorry not to be clearer.

> , then yes, it is the
> kind of thing I would like to be able to test without having to
> duplicate the precondition of XMLParser.parse() in every unit test of
> a class that is using XMLParser.

Do you find yourself needing to specify this precondition in many
tests?  Do you catch many bugs by doing so?

I find myself most naturally tending to write fully-specified methods,
where the behavior of parse(null) is defined (even if the definition
is throwing an exception), so I don't have a lot of experience with
the changes in testing strategies when using preconditions.  I'm
curious to hear your experience

  David Saff
